p: Since the inhibitors of NO production in macrophages via lipopolysaccharide (LPS) stimulation are considered as anti-inflammatory agents, we determined the inhibitory effect of W. glabra essential oil on the NO production of RAW 264.7 macrophages using Griess assay [ 8]. As shown in Figure 1, the essential oil samples at 20 μg·mL −1 and 100 μg·mL −1 exhibited significant anti-inflammatory activities on the LPS stimulated cells in a dose-dependent manner. Especially, the essential oil at 100 μg·mL −1 showed a stronger inhibitory effect than the positive control.
